import Mathlib.Data.Real.EReal
import Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Basic
import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.Lebesgue.Basic
import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.Bochner

import SBSProofs.Utils
import SBSProofs.PushForward
import SBSProofs.RKHS

local macro_rules | `($x ^ $y) => `(HPow.hPow $x $y)

open scoped RealInnerProductSpace
open BigOperators Finset ENNReal NNReal MeasureTheory RKHS

set_option trace.Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite true
set_option maxHeartbeats 400000

/-
  We defined measures Î¼ and Ï€ (Î½ is considered as the standard Lebesgue measure) along with their densities (finite and non-zero on the entire space)
-/
variable {d : â„•} (hd : d â‰  0) {Î© : Set (Vector â„ d)}

variable [MeasureSpace Î©]

variable (Î¼ Ï€ Î½ : Measure Î©) [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] [IsFiniteMeasure Ï€] (dÎ¼ dÏ€ : Î© â†’ â„â‰¥0âˆ)

/-
  Î¼ << Ï€ << Î½, they both admit density w.r.t. Î½.
-/
variable (_h1 : absolutely_continuous Î¼ Ï€) (_h2 : absolutely_continuous Ï€ Î½)
example : absolutely_continuous Î¼ Î½ := absolutely_continuous_trans _h1 _h2

variable (hÎ¼ : is_density Î¼ Î½ dÎ¼) (hÏ€ : is_density Ï€ Î½ dÏ€) (mdÎ¼ : Measurable dÎ¼) (mdÏ€ : Measurable dÏ€) (hdÎ¼ : âˆ€x, dÎ¼ x â‰  0 âˆ§ dÎ¼ x â‰  âˆ) (hdÏ€ : âˆ€x, dÏ€ x â‰  0 âˆ§ dÏ€ x â‰  âˆ)


variable [IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼] [IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€]

/-
  We define a RKHS of Î© â†’ â„ functions.
-/
variable (Hâ‚€ : Set (Î© â†’ â„)) [NormedAddCommGroup Hâ‚€] [InnerProductSpace â„ Hâ‚€] [s : RKHS Hâ‚€]

/--
We consider that the left-hand side of the equivalence holds for all x. In the future, we want to take into account that it only holds for almost all x w.r.t. Î¼.
-/
def positive_definite_kernel := âˆ€ (f : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„), (0 â‰¤ âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, f i x * s.k x x' * f i x') âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ§ (âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, f i x * s.k x x' * f i x') âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ‚Î¼ = 0 â†” âˆ€i, âˆ€x, f i x = 0)

variable (h_kernel_positive : positive_definite_kernel Î¼ Hâ‚€)

/-===============================KERNEL STEIN DISCREPANCY===============================-/
/-
Here, we prove that KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) is a valid discrepancy measure and that Ï€ is the only fixed point of Î¦â‚œ(Î¼).
-/

/-
  From here, as the derivative of multivariate function are hard to define and to manipulate (defining the gradient, the divergence...), we define the gradient of *f* as follows:
  f  : Î© â†’ â„
  df : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„
       i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± f(x)

  For vector-valued function, we defined them as follows:
  f  : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„
       i â†¦ x â†¦ f(x)â±
  df : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„
       i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± f(x)â±

  Also, we assume some simple lemmas using the above formalism. Sometimes, these lemmas are not rigorously defined but, in our framework, it is more than enough.
-/

/- dk : x â†¦ i â†¦ y â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± k(x, y) -/
variable (dk : Î© â†’ range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/- d_ln_Ï€ : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± ln (Î¼(x) / Ï€(x)) -/
variable (d_ln_Ï€ : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/-
  Definition of the steepest direction Ï• and its derivative.
-/
variable (Ï• : product_RKHS Hâ‚€ hd) (dÏ• : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/- We will use this assumption only when the function is trivially integrable (e.g. derivative of integrable functions). -/
variable (is_integrable_Hâ‚€ : âˆ€ (f : Î© â†’ â„), Integrable f Î¼)

/-
d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± ln (Ï€(x) / Î¼(x))
-/
variable (d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/-
Simple derivative rule: if the derivative is 0 âˆ€x, then the function is constant.
-/
variable (hd_ln_Ï€_Î¼ : (âˆ€i, âˆ€x, d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x = 0) â†’ (âˆƒ c, âˆ€ x, log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c))

/-
dÏ€' : i â†¦ x â†¦ âˆ‚xâ± Ï€(x)
-/
variable (dÏ€' : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„)

/-
Simple derivative rule: âˆ‚xâ± ln (Ï€(x)) * Ï€(x) = âˆ‚xâ± Ï€(x).
-/
variable (hÏ€' : âˆ€x, âˆ€i, ENNReal.toReal (dÏ€ x) * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x)


variable [Norm Î©]
/--
  Stein class of measure. f is in the Stein class of Î¼ if, âˆ€i âˆˆ Set.univ, lim_(â€–xâ€– â†’ âˆ) Î¼(x) * Ï•(x)â± = 0.
-/
def SteinClass (f : range d â†’ Î© â†’ â„) (dÎ¼ : Î© â†’ â„â‰¥0âˆ) := âˆ€ x, tends_to_infty (fun (x : Î©) â†¦ â€–xâ€–) â†’ âˆ€i, ENNReal.toReal (dÎ¼ x) * f i x = 0


/-
  Kernel Stein Discrepancy
-/
variable (KSD : Measure Î© â†’ Measure Î© â†’ â„)

/--
KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) = âŸªâˆ‡ln Ï€/Î¼, PÎ¼ âˆ‡ln Ï€/Î¼âŸ«_LÂ²(Î¼). We assume here that KSD is also equal to âˆ« x, âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, (d_ln_Ï€ i x * Ï• i x + dÏ• i x) âˆ‚Î¼.
-/
def is_ksd := KSD Î¼ Ï€ = (âˆ« x in Set.univ, (âˆ« x' in Set.univ, (âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x * s.k x x' * d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x') âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ‚Î¼) âˆ§ (KSD Î¼ Ï€ = âˆ« x, âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.univ, (d_ln_Ï€ i x * (Ï• i).1 x + dÏ• i x) âˆ‚Î¼)

/-
  KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) is originally defined as â€–Ï•^â‹†â€–Â²_H, it is therefore non-negative.
-/
def is_ksd_norm := KSD Î¼ Ï€ = â€–Ï•â€–^2

/-
  Ï• is in the Stein class of Ï€
-/
variable (hstein : SteinClass (Î» i â†¦ (Ï• i).1) dÏ€)

/--
  We show that, if Ï• is in the Stein class of Ï€, KSD is a valid discrepancy measure i.e. Î¼ = Ï€ â†” KSD(Î¼ | Ï€) = 0.
-/
lemma KSD_is_valid_discrepancy (hksd : is_ksd hd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ d_ln_Ï€ Ï• dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD) : Î¼ = Ï€ â†” KSD Î¼ Ï€ = 0 :=

h1: Integrable (fun x => âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x) Î¼

âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©), âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ i a * â†‘(Ï• i) a âˆ‚Î¼ =
  âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ i a * â†‘(Ï• i) a âˆ‚Î¼
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Set.toFinset_univ:1000, Set.toFinset Set.univ ==> Finset.univ
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.mem_range:1000, x âˆˆ Finset.range d ==> x < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @nonempty_subtype:1000, Nonempty { x // x < d } ==> âˆƒ a, a < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @isEmpty_subtype:1000, IsEmpty { x // x < d } ==> âˆ€ (x : â„•), Â¬x < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @not_lt:1000, Â¬x < d ==> d â‰¤ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] not_isEmpty_of_nonempty:1000, IsEmpty â„• ==> False
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] not_isEmpty_of_nonempty:1000, IsEmpty â„• ==> False
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.univ_unique:1000, has unassigned metavariables after unification
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.univ_eq_attach:1000, Finset.univ ==> Finset.attach (Finset.range d)
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict_univ:1000, Î¼.restrict Set.univ ==> Î¼

âˆ« (x : â†‘Î©) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ x_1 âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ x_1 x * â†‘(Ï• x_1) x * (dÏ€ x).toReal âˆ‚Î½ +
    âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©), âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, dÏ• i a âˆ‚Ï€ =

[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] hÏ€':1000, (dÏ€ xâœ).toReal * d_ln_Ï€ x xâœ ==> dÏ€' x xâœ

[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Set.toFinset_univ:1000, Set.toFinset Set.univ ==> Finset.univ
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.mem_range:1000, x âˆˆ Finset.range d ==> x < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @nonempty_subtype:1000, Nonempty { x // x < d } ==> âˆƒ a, a < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @isEmpty_subtype:1000, IsEmpty { x // x < d } ==> âˆ€ (x : â„•), Â¬x < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @not_lt:1000, Â¬x < d ==> d â‰¤ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] not_isEmpty_of_nonempty:1000, IsEmpty â„• ==> False
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] not_isEmpty_of_nonempty:1000, IsEmpty â„• ==> False
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.univ_unique:1000, has unassigned metavariables after unification
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.univ_eq_attach:1000, Finset.univ ==> Finset.attach (Finset.range d)
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict_univ:1000, Ï€.restrict Set.univ ==> Ï€
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @eq_self:1000, âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©), âˆ‘ x âˆˆ Finset.attach (Finset.range d), dÏ• x a âˆ‚Ï€ =
      âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©), âˆ‘ x âˆˆ Finset.attach (Finset.range d), dÏ• x a âˆ‚Ï€ ==> True

instâœâµ: IsFiniteMeasure Ï€
dÎ¼, dÏ€: â†‘Î© â†’ â„â‰¥0âˆ

instâœâ´: IsProbabilityMeasure Î¼
instâœÂ³: IsProbabilityMeasure Ï€
Hâ‚€: Set (â†‘Î© â†’ â„)
instâœÂ²: NormedAddCommGroup â†‘Hâ‚€
instâœÂ¹: InnerProductSpace â„ â†‘Hâ‚€
s: RKHS Hâ‚€
h_kernel_positive: positive_definite_kernel Î¼ Hâ‚€
dk: â†‘Î© â†’ { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
d_ln_Ï€: { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
Ï•: product_RKHS Hâ‚€ hd
dÏ•: { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
is_integrable_Hâ‚€: âˆ€ (f : â†‘Î© â†’ â„), Integrable f Î¼
d_ln_Ï€_Î¼: { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
hd_ln_Ï€_Î¼: (âˆ€ (i : { x // x âˆˆ range d }) (x : â†‘Î©), d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x = 0) â†’ âˆƒ c, âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c
dÏ€': { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
hÏ€': âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©) (i : { x // x âˆˆ range d }), (dÏ€ x).toReal * d_ln_Ï€ i x = dÏ€' i x
instâœ: Norm â†‘Î©
KSD: Measure â†‘Î© â†’ Measure â†‘Î© â†’ â„
hstein: SteinClass (fun i => â†‘(Ï• i)) dÏ€
hksd: is_ksd hd Î¼ Ï€ Hâ‚€ d_ln_Ï€ Ï• dÏ• d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ KSD
h: Î¼ = Ï€
split_sum: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©),
  âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, (d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x + dÏ• i x) =
    âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x + âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, dÏ• i x
h1: Integrable (fun x => âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x) Î¼
h2: Integrable (fun x => âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, dÏ• i x) Î¼
int_univâœ: âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©), âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ i a * â†‘(Ï• i) a âˆ‚Î¼ =
  âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ i a * â†‘(Ï• i) a âˆ‚Î¼
mul_dist: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©),
  (dÏ€ x).toReal * âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, (fun i => d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x) i =
    âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, (fun i => d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x) i * (dÏ€ x).toReal
mul_comm: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©) (i : { x // x âˆˆ range d }), d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x * (dÏ€ x).toReal = (dÏ€ x).toReal * d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x
int_univ: âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©), âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, dÏ• i a âˆ‚Ï€ = âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, dÏ• i a âˆ‚Ï€
mp

  âˆ« (a : â†‘Î©) in Set.univ, âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, d_ln_Ï€ i a * â†‘(Ï• i) a âˆ‚Î¼
mul_dist: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©),
  (dÏ€ x).toReal * âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, (fun i => d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x) i =
    âˆ‘ i âˆˆ Set.toFinset Set.univ, (fun i => d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x) i * (dÏ€ x).toReal
mul_comm: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©) (i : { x // x âˆˆ range d }), d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x * (dÏ€ x).toReal = (dÏ€ x).toReal * d_ln_Ï€ i x * â†‘(Ï• i) x

[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @MeasureTheory.Measure.restrict_univ:1000, Î½.restrict Set.univ ==> Î½
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Set.toFinset_univ:1000, Set.toFinset Set.univ ==> Finset.univ
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.mem_range:1000, x âˆˆ Finset.range d ==> x < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @nonempty_subtype:1000, Nonempty { x // x < d } ==> âˆƒ a, a < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @isEmpty_subtype:1000, IsEmpty { x // x < d } ==> âˆ€ (x : â„•), Â¬x < d
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @not_lt:1000, Â¬x < d ==> d â‰¤ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] not_isEmpty_of_nonempty:1000, IsEmpty â„• ==> False
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] not_isEmpty_of_nonempty:1000, IsEmpty â„• ==> False
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.univ_unique:1000, has unassigned metavariables after unification
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @Finset.univ_eq_attach:1000, Finset.univ ==> Finset.attach (Finset.range d)
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @add_right_neg:1000, âˆ« (x : â†‘Î©),
        âˆ‘ x_1 âˆˆ Finset.attach (Finset.range d), dÏ€' x_1 x * â†‘(Ï• x_1) x âˆ‚Î½ +
      -âˆ« (x : â†‘Î©), âˆ‘ x_1 âˆˆ Finset.attach (Finset.range d), dÏ€' x_1 x * â†‘(Ï• x_1) x âˆ‚Î½ ==> 0
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @eq_self:1000, 0 = 0 ==> True

is_integrable_Hâ‚€: âˆ€ (f : â†‘Î© â†’ â„), Integrable f Î¼
d_ln_Ï€_Î¼: { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„
hd_ln_Ï€_Î¼: (âˆ€ (i : { x // x âˆˆ range d }) (x : â†‘Î©), d_ln_Ï€_Î¼ i x = 0) â†’ âˆƒ c, âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), log (dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x) = c
dÏ€': { x // x âˆˆ range d } â†’ â†‘Î© â†’ â„

    -- We show that, since dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x â‰  0 and finite, dÎ¼ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * dÏ€ x.

âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), dÎ¼ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * dÏ€ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] â† cancel_ln_exp:1000, ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) ==> dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @ENNReal.div_eq_inv_mul:1000, dÎ¼ x / dÏ€ x ==> (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ * dÎ¼ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] mul_right_comm (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ (dÎ¼ x) (dÏ€ x):1000, (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ * dÎ¼ x * dÏ€ x ==> (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ * dÏ€ x * dÎ¼ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] ENNReal.inv_mul_cancel (hdÏ€ x).left (hdÏ€ x).right:1000, (dÏ€ x)â»Â¹ * dÏ€ x ==> 1
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @one_mul:1000, 1 * dÎ¼ x ==> dÎ¼ x
[Meta.Tactic.simp.rewrite] @eq_self:1000, dÎ¼ x = dÎ¼ x ==> True
Goals accomplished! ğŸ™
Goals accomplished! ğŸ™


    -- We show by contradiction that ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) = 1. If it is â‰  1, this implies a contradiction as dÎ¼ x = ENNReal.ofReal (Real.exp c) * dÏ€ x and âˆ«â» x, dÎ¼ x âˆ‚Î½ = 1.

dÎ¼_propor: âˆ€ (x : â†‘Î©), dÎ¼ x = dÏ€ x

âˆ«â» (x : â†‘Î©) in s, dÎ¼ x * 1 âˆ‚Î½ = âˆ«â» (x : â†‘Î©) in s, dÏ€ x * 1 âˆ‚Î½

/--
  Ï€ is the only fixed point of Î¦â‚œ(Î¼). We proved that by showing that, if Î¼ = Ï€, Ï•^* = 0 and Ï•^* â‰  0 otherwise.
